page.title: 15CLIMATE/CROPS, BURSTON AREA
page.content:
Weather is the most important factor in farming.1985 has been one of the wet- test summers on record which has given plenty of grass for grazing and silage. Owing to the lack of sunshine little good hay has been made,a lot rotting in the fields.
It has been disastrous for cereal grow- ing, causing laid crops and uneven late ripening requiring artificial drying. Dairy cattle have milked quite well and beef cattle have maintained good growth
It is now the middle of September and if the cold wet conditions continue grass growth will slow up and cattle will have to be housed and fed costly winter rations.1985 will not be a very profitable year.
